result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyrie A. Snow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.
Maintain full-time employment and/or schooling. Graduate from high school or obtain GED/HSED.
Must write a minimum 250 word apology letter to the victim of the jewelry theft. Must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay the DNA surcharge.
Upon successful completion of probation and all conditions, Youthful Expungement pursuant to 973.015 will be granted.

timeConds.notes: To perform 10 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from DOC Agent Kyna Taylor indicating defendants status with DOC. Email between DA's office and JA.

Defendant Kyrie A. Snow not in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. No appearance by defendant or probation agent. Court sets another probation review hearing. Agent can appear by phone. Defendant must appear in person. If defendant doesn't appear, court may then be issuing a warrant for her arrest. Notice will be sent to defendant and agent.  Probation review hearing scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
from ADA Korb requesting probation review hearing prior to defendants 8/17/16 discharge date. Court sets hearing.
Probation review hearing on July 22, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kyrie A. Snow in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty.  State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Kyrie A. Snow in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 11:45 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 5/15/15 by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 8/21/15)
